If the child is conscious and coughing, encourage them to keep coughing. If they can’t cough, speak, or breathe, you can give up to five back blows between the shoulder blades with the heel of your hand, followed—if the object does not clear—by up to five abdominal thrusts (or chest thrusts for infants under one year old). Repeat until the object is dislodged or help arrives. Always seek professional training in basic first aid, and consult a licensed medical professional for definitive guidance.
